intro: Fumaria capreolata subsp. media, commonly known as the common yellow corydalis, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting various pollinators like bees and flies.
